line_1: Drove for a crown, or Post-boys for an Inn;
line_2: As fast as JEHU, oil'd for AHAB's sin,

line_1: The blind, fat landlord of the Old Crown Inn, —
line_2: With Andrew Collett we the year begin,

line_2: Hope to embolden me then did begin,

line_2: And think it folly, if not sin,

line_1: Than the low cot, or humble inn.
line_2: From flattery, feasting, dice, and din;

line_2: And every health which I begin,

line_2: I fly from Falshood's specious grin;

line_1: It buys me Freedom, at an inn.
line_2: Which Iacqueys else might hope to win;

line_2: Thro' rain or shine, thro' thick or thin,

line_1: That sprang at first from yonder noisy inn;
line_2: And hark! the riots of the Green begin,
